Carleton University Admission is ongoing for all applicants who want to apply for Graduate program the Admission requirements is outlined below for interested candidate.

Is It Hard to Get into Carleton University?

The difficulty of getting into Carleton University can vary depending on the program and the number of applicants. Generally speaking, Carleton University is considered to be a moderately selective university with an acceptance rate of around 70% for undergraduate programs.

However, some undergraduate programs at Carleton can be more competitive than others, and the admission requirements and acceptance rates for graduate programs can also vary widely. Some graduate programs at Carleton University may have more stringent admission requirements and a lower acceptance rate than undergraduate programs.

Carleton University Admissions

FAQ Answers

What are the general admission requirements for graduate programs at Carleton University?

 The general admission requirements for graduate programs at Carleton University include a four-year undergraduate degree or equivalent, a minimum grade point average (GPA), and English language proficiency for international students. Additionally, some programs may have specific admission requirements such as relevant work experience, standardized test scores, or additional application materials.

What is the minimum GPA requirement for admission to Carleton graduate programs?

 The minimum GPA requirement for admission to Carleton graduate programs is usually around a B+ (75-79% or 9/12), but this can vary by program.

Do I need to take standardized tests like the GRE or GMAT for graduate admissions at Carleton?

 Some graduate programs at Carleton University require applicants to take standardized tests like the GRE or GMAT as part of the admission requirements. However, not all programs require these tests, so it’s important to check the specific requirements for the program you are interested in.

Do I need to submit letters of recommendation or a statement of purpose for Carleton graduate admissions?

 Yes, most graduate programs at Carleton University require applicants to submit letters of recommendation and a statement of purpose or personal statement as part of the application process. These documents help the admissions committee evaluate your academic and professional qualifications, as well as your fit for the program.

Is work experience required for admission to Carleton graduate programs?

 Work experience is not always required for admission to Carleton graduate programs, but some programs may prefer or require applicants to have relevant work experience in a particular field. It’s important to check the specific requirements for the program you are interested in.

Carleton Graduate Admission Requirements

Admission Requirements by Programs
 master’s Minimum Admission Requirements

  • Four-year bachelor’s degree equivalent: Honors Bachelor’s degree
  • Minimum requirements in general: 60-69% or 2nd Class (upper division)

Students who have only a Nation Diploma (ND) and Higher National Diploma (HND) are not eligible for admission .students that present a Post-Graduate Diploma (PGD) may be eligible for admission to a master’s program.

Doctoral Minimum Admission Requirements

  • Master’s /graduate degree equivalent: Master’s
  • Minimum requirements in general (B+) :69% or 2nd Class (upper division)
  • Click here to view country requirements by country

Minimum Language Proficiency Test (ESL) test score requirement:

Language Proficiency Test Score
Canadian Academic English Language Test (CAEL, CAEL-CE) 70 (least amount  of 60 in each band)
TOEFL iBT (including iBT Home Edition) 86 (20 in reading and listening; 22 in speaking and writing)
IELTS (Academic) 6.5 IELTS (minimum 6.0 in each band)
Pearson Test of English (PTE) (Academic) 60 general (maximum 60 in each Communicative Skill)

Please note that some graduate programs may require a higher level of understanding of the English language and will have ESL requirements .it is your responsibility to review and meet the minimum requirements of the program to which you are applying. the Faculty of Graduate and Postdoctoral Affairs reserves the right to further documentation or additional testing if it is necessary to demonstrate the required level of English language proficiency.

Carleton Graduate majors
Carleton University offers a wide range of graduate programs across various faculties. Some of the graduate majors offered at Carleton are:
  1. Architecture
  2. Art History
  3. Biology
  4. Business Administration
  5. Civil Engineering
  6. Communication
  7. Computer Science
  8. Criminology and Criminal Justice
  9. Economics
  10. Education
  11. Electrical and Computer Engineering
  12. English
  13. Environmental Engineering
  14. Geography and Environmental Studies
  15. History
  16. Industrial Design
  17. International Affairs
  18. Law
  19. Linguistics
  20. Mathematics and Statistics
  21. Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
  22. Neuroscience
  23. Philosophy
  24. Physics
  25. Political Science
  26. Psychology
  27. Public Policy and Administration
  28. Sociology
  29. Social Work

Required Documents for Carleton Graduate Admission Requirements

Applications to graduate programs at Carleton University need different credentials such as the following aptitude test results

  • Transcripts,
  • Letters of reference,
  • Statement of intent, a writing sample,
  • CV/Resumé, etc

This additional information is necessary to offer more background to assess an applicant’s suitability for assessment into a graduate program.

Steps on how to apply for Carleton Graduate Admission Requirements

  • Click here to start up the application
  • Fill in the appropriate information and click on submit

Carleton Graduate tuition
Carleton University tuition fees for graduate programs at Carleton University vary depending on the program and the student’s residency status (i.e. Canadian citizens, permanent residents, or international students). An estimate of the tuition at Carleton University for Graduate programs are;
  • Canadian citizens and permanent residents: $6,535 to $10,066 per year (depending on the program)
  • International students: $17,786 to $26,703 per year (depending on the program)
